items.task: Bring a copy of your genetic test results
items.why: Your provider needs to see the exact results, including variant IDs and classifications

items.task: Prepare a family health history going back at least 3 generations
items.why: Family history helps put genetic results in context and assess true risk

items.task: List your current health conditions and medications
items.why: Your overall health picture affects how results are interpreted

items.task: Write down your questions in advance
items.why: Appointments can be overwhelming - having written questions ensures you cover everything

items.task: Consider bringing a family member or friend
items.why: They can help take notes and provide emotional support

items.task: Know the name of the testing company and test type
items.why: Different tests have different limitations that affect interpretation

family_history_worksheet.title: Family Health History Information to Gather

Current age or age at death
Age when each condition was diagnosed

categories.category: Particularly important conditions to ask about:
items: Heart disease (age at diagnosis or heart attack)

when_needed: DTC test showed a pathogenic or likely pathogenic variant

Making medical decisions based on genetic information
Results don't match expected family pattern
what_to_expect: Clinical test ordered through healthcare provider
